page.title: 17Good Old Days
page.content: Mr.Strawbridge also feels the roads in Culmstock have changed since he was a lad.For him the increase in traffic has meant a far more hectic life style however.This is perhaps one of the reasons why there has been a decrease in the wild life on the banks of the Culm.Mr. Strawbridge remembers far more water voles, rabbits ,foxes, moorhens, kingfishers and dippers than there are now.The wild life may have been encouraged by the fact that the hedge rows were higher in those days.Treats for the children were fewer then,a trip to the seaside or roast chicken for dinner being something to remember.That doesn't mean life was all dull.Mr Strawbridge recalls burning the headmaster's cane and spreading caps on the floor for the poor man to walk on!
